results.content: I am about to start a project, a very important one! And I wanted to do it in a certain way. One that used a JUnit style testing framework and also it would have been nice to have Java's strong type checking capabilities. Fortunately for me, I have been programming since 1982 and managed to figure out the subtleties that novice programmers could miss when doing your course. Beyond, you have presented just about EVERYTHING I need to get tings done! I am so grateful to your taking the time to put together this course. Thank you for showing me how to setup the extra features such as the async framework. I can now use traditional try/catch blocks once again in production code!

results.content: There is some good content in this course, but the production quality, delivery, and structure are weak. The author is clearly quite knowledgeable on this subject, but lacks proper teaching skills. Explanations are haphazard and jump around a lot. I am already reasonably experienced in Node, Express, and TypeScript, but I found this course hard to follow. The sound quality on many of the videos is poor, there are gaps where the sound is missing completely, and many recordings end mid-sentence. The title is also misleading, as only a few short sections are devoted to the async-await pattern as used in TypeScript, and the explanation of this pattern isn't clearly explained.
